edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines

Class OfflineOtReceiverRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines.OfflineOtReceiverRoutine

  • public class OfflineOtReceiverRoutine
extends java.lang.Object
    Runs the receiver side of the malicious OT protocol.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      A constructor that sets the class members.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      Generates inputs and runs the receiver side of the malicious OT protocol.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OfflineOtReceiverRoutine

        public OfflineOtReceiverRoutine(ExecutionParameters execution,
                                CryptoPrimitives primitives,
                                OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver maliciousOtReceiver,
                                KProbeResistantMatrix matrix,
                                Channel channel,
                                BucketList<LimitedBundle> buckets)
        A constructor that sets the class members.
        Parameters:
        execution - Contains some parameters used in the OT. For example the bucket size.
        primitives - Primitives objects to use during the protocol execution.
        maliciousOtReceiver - The inner malicious OT receiver object.
        matrix - The matrix to convert the original Y1 input to the Y1 extended inputs.
        channel - Used to communicate between the parties in the commitment protocol. In the OT protocol the communication is done in the native code and not using this channel.
        buckets - Contain the circuits.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Generates inputs and runs the receiver side of the malicious OT protocol.
